page.title: 06THE CATTLE MARKET IN HELSTON
page.content: On Monday's there is a cattle market it seemed large but is probably quite small compared to some others. {About twenty years ago}it moved to a larger site and is now mostly under cover. When the cattle arrive, they are weighed, put in their pens and numbered. We only saw cattle being sold. Occasionally they sell pigs and sheep as well. { About 200 animals}are sold each week. The auctioneer stands on a rostrum and he shouts out the prices very quickly whilst looking for bids. The farmers make different signs to him, to show that they are bidding. There is a lot of noise and bustle of farmers doing business. The animals seemed to be very frightened.
